1750.text: Peak of the Little Ice Age

1752.text: The Lightning rod invented by Benjamin Franklin

1754.text: Treaty of Pondicherry ends Second Carnatic War and recognizes Muhammed Ali Khan Wallajah as Nawab of the Carnatic
King's College founded by a royal charter of George II of Great Britain
The French and Indian War, Fought in the U.S. and Canada mostly between the French and their allies and the English and their allies (the North American chapter of the Seven Years' War)

1755.text: A Dictionary of the English Language by Samuel Johnson

main.title: A Dictionary of the English Language

1755.text: The tallest wooden Bodhisattva statue in the world is erected at Puning Temple, Chengde, China.

The Treaty of Giyanti is signed, effectively partitioning the Mataram Sultanate. The VOC recognizes Mangkubumi as Sultan Hamengkubuwana I, who rules half of Central Java. Hamengkubuwana I then established Yogyakarta Sultanate, moves to Yogya and renames the city Yogyakarta
The Great Upheaval, forced population transfer of the French Acadian population from Nova Scotia and New Brunswick

1756.text: Seven Years' War fought among European powers in various theaters around the world
The Third Carnatic War fought between the British, the French, the Marathas, and Mysore in India

1757.text: Battle of Plassey signaled the beginning of formal British rule in India after years of commercial activity under the auspices of the East India Company
Salatiga treaty between Prince Sambernyawa with Pakubuwono III and Hamengkubuwono I further partitioning the remnant of Mataram Sultanate, the Mangkunegaran Grand Duchy wasestablished

1758.text: British colonel James Wolfe issues the Wolfe's Manifesto

related.title: Great Britain in the Seven Years' War

1759.text: French commander Louis-Joseph de Montcalm and British commander James Wolfe die during the Battle of the Plains of Abraham

main.title: Battle of the Plains of Abraham

1759.text: First publication of Tristram Shandy by Laurence Sterne

main.title: The Life and Opinions of Tristram Shandy, Gentleman

1760.text: George III became King of Britain

main.title: George III of the United Kingdom

1761.text: Maratha Empire defeated at Battle of Panipat
The problem of Longitude was finally resolved by the fourth chronometer of John Harrison

1762.text: Orfeo ed Euridice, the first 'reform opera' by Gluck, performed in Vienna
Reign of Catherine the Great of Russia begins

1763.text: Hyder Ali leads the Kingdom of Mysore to conquer the Kingdom of Keladi
Thomas Bayes publishes first version of Bayes' Theorem, paving the way for Bayesian probability
Treaty of Paris ends Seven Years' War and Third Carnatic War

1764.text: The Spinning Jenny created by James Hargreaves brought on the Industrial Revolution

1765.text: James Watt enhances Newcomen's steam engine, allowing new steel technologies
Stamp Act introduced into the American colonies by the UK Parliament

1766.text: Anglo-Mysore Wars between the Kingdom of Mysore and the British East India Company begin

1767.text: The Konbaung Dynasty of Burma (now Myanmar) conquers the Ayutthaya kingdom after seven years

1768.text: War of the Bar Confederation begins, marking the first serious national military effort to restore Polish independence
Russo-Turkish War begins, which upon its resolution in 1774 will prompt the Eastern Question

1769.text: French expeditions capture clove plants in Ambon, ending the Dutch East India Company monopoly of the plant
Spanish missionaries established the first of 21 missions in California
James Cook mapped the boundaries of the Pacific Ocean and discovered many Pacific Islands, as well as mapping New Zealand and Australia
The British East India company creates the Bengal famine of 1770 killed one third of the Bengal population, by forcing widespread forced cultivation of opium over local food crops

1770.text: James Cook claims the East Coast of Australia (New South Wales) for Great Britain
The Great Famine in Czech lands kills around 500,000, leading to peasant uprisings

1771.text: Richard Arkwright and his partners build the world's first water-powered mill at Cromford
The enormous Putuo Zongcheng Temple complex of Chengde, China is completed

1772.text: Gustav III of Sweden stages a coup d'état, becoming almost an absolute monarch
Partitions of Poland marks the end of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth and erase Poland from the map for 123 years
Reformer Johann Friedrich Struensee executed in Denmark

1773.text: East India Company starts operations in Bengal to smuggle Opium into China
Pugachev's Rebellion was the largest peasant revolt in Russia's history
The Qing Dynasty completes the huge literary compilation Siku Quanshu, the largest collection of books in Chinese history

1775.text: Joseph Priestley first synthesis of 'phlogisticated nitrous air' Nitrous Oxide (laughing gas)

1776.text: The Steamboat invented by Claude de Jouffroy
The Wealth of Nations, foundation of the modern theory of economy, was published by Adam Smith
United States Declaration of Independence adopted by the Continental Congress in Philadelphia
The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire was published by Edward Gibbon, marking the beginnings of modern historiography

main.title: The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire

1778.text: James Cook becomes first European on the Hawaiian Islands
Tây Sơn Dynasty established in Vietnam

Royal Batavian Society of Arts and Sciences was established by a group of Dutch intellectuals. This institution is the pioneer of scientific efforts in Indonesia and the founder of National Museum of Indonesia

main.title: Royal Batavian Society of Arts and Sciences

1779.text: Amazing Grace published by John Newton
Photosynthesis was first discovered by Jan Ingenhousz
Xhosa Wars between British and Boer settlers and the Xhosas in South African Republic

1780.text: Outbreak of the indigenous rebellion led by Túpac Amaru II in Peru

1781.text: William Herschel announces discovery of Uranus
Serfdom abolished by Joseph II in the Austrian monarchy (although this returned, it was eventually successfully re-implemented in 1848)

1783.text: Famine in Iceland caused by the eruption of the Laki volcano
Russian Empire annexed the Crimean Khanate
The Treaty of Paris formally ends the American War of Independence

1784.text: The Argand lamp invented by Aimé Argand
The Bifocals invented by Benjamin Franklin

1785.text: The Automatic flour mill invented by Oliver Evans
The Power loom invented by Edmund Cartwright

Imam Sheikh Mansur, a Chechen warrior and Muslim mystic, led a coalition of Muslim Caucasian tribes from throughout the Caucasus in a holy war against the Russian settlers and and military bases in the Caucasus, as well as against the local traditionalists, who followed the traditional customs and common law (Adat), rather than the theocratic Sharia
Northwest Indian War between the United States and Native Americans

related.title: Native Americans in the United States

1786.text: Poems, Chiefly in the Scottish Dialect by Robert Burns published
The Marriage of Figaro, opera by Mozart
The Threshing machine invented by Andrew Meikle

1787.text: Freed slaves from London founded Freetown in present-day Sierra Leone
Jacques Charles' experiments with balloons will lead to the formation of Charles's Law, which is formalised and published in 1802 by Joseph Louis Gay-Lussac
Kansei Reforms instituted in Japan by Matsudaira Sadanobu
United States Constitution was written in Philadelphia and submitted to the states for ratification

1788.text: First European settlement established in Australia at Sydney
First French Quaker community established in Congénies
New Hampshire ratifies the United States Constitution as the 9th state, and by the terms of Article VII it is in effect
InconfidÃªncia Mineira, conspiracy against the colonial authorities in Brazil

1789.text: Antoine Lavoisier discovers the law of conservation of mass, the basis for chemistry, and begins modern chemistry
George Washington elected President of the United States. Served until 1797
Great Britain and Spain dispute the Nootka Sound during the Nootka Crisis

1790.text: United States of Belgium proclaimed following the Brabant Revolution, which is almost immediately surpressed by the re-establishment of Austrian control

related.title: Treaty of Union (United States of Belgium)

1791.text: Suppression of the Liège Revolution by Austrian forces and the re-establishment of the Prince-Bishopric of Liège
The Constitutional Act creates the two provinces of Upper and Lower Canada in British North America
The Magic Flute, opera by Mozart
George Vancouver explores the world during the Vancouver Expedition
The Haitian Revolution slave revolt in Saint-Domingue begins, which will result in the elimination of slavery there and the founding of the Republic of Haiti 13 years later

1792.text: King Gustav III of Sweden was assassinated by a conspiracy of noblemen
New York Stock & Exchange Board founded
Vindication of the Rights of Women by Mary Wollstonecraft

main.title: A Vindication of the Rights of Woman

1792.text: The French Revolutionary Wars begin, which will lead into the Napoleonic Wars from 1803-1815

1793.text: The largest yellow fever epidemic in American history killed as many as 5,000 people in Philadelphia
Revolt in the Vendée against the French Republic at the time of the Revolution

1794.text: Jay's Treaty concluded between Great Britain and the United States, by which the Western outposts in the Great Lakes are returned to the U.S., and commerce between the two countries is
Kościuszko Uprising in the Commonwealth of Poland
Qajar dynasty founded in Iran after replacing the Zand dynasty

1795.text: Establishment of the French-backed Batavian Republic in present-day Netherlands
Kamehameha I of the Island of Hawaii defeats the Oahuans at the Battle of Nu'uanu
Mohammad Khan Qajar razes Tbilisi to the ground
Pinckney's Treaty between the United States and Spain granted the Mississippi Territory to the US
The Marseillaise officially adopted as the French national anthem

1796.text: Battle of Montenotte. Engagement in the War of the First Coalition. Napoleon Bonaparte's first victory as an army commander
British forces eject Dutch from Ceylon
Edward Jenner administers the first smallpox vaccination. Smallpox killed an estimated 400,000 Europeans each year during the 18th century (including five reigning monarchs).
Mungo Park, backed by the African Association, is the first European to set eyes on the Niger River in Africa
The White Lotus Rebellion against the Manchu Dynasty in China

1797.text: Napoleon's invasion and partition of the Republic of Venice ended over 1,000 years of independence for the Serene Republic

1798.text: Edward Jenner publishes a treatise about smallpox vaccination
The Irish Rebellion failed to overthrow British rule in Ireland
The Lithographic printing process invented by Alois Senefelder
Quasi-War between the United States and France

1799.text: Dutch East India Company is dissolved
Napoleon staged a coup d'état and became First Consul of France
Rosetta stone discovered by Napoleon's troops
The assassination of the 14th Tu'i Kanokupolu, Tuku'aho, plunges Tonga into half a century of civil war
Tipu Sultan was killed in a battle with the British forces

1800.text: The nationalised Dutch East Indies is established, in the wake of the bankruptcy of the Dutch East India Company (VOC)

1801.text: Giuseppe Piazzi discovers the dwarf planet Ceres
Thomas Jefferson elected President of the United States by the House of Representatives, following a tie in the Electoral College
The Kingdom of Great Britain and the Kingdom of Ireland merge to form the United Kingdom

main.title: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland

1801.text: Ranjit Singh crowned as King of Punjab
Napoleon signs the Concordat of 1801 with the Pope
Assassination of Tsar Paul I of Russia
British defeat French at the Second Battle of Abukir
The First Barbary War and the Second Barbary War between the United States and the Barbary States of North Africa

1802.text: Treaty of Amiens between France and the United Kingdom ends the War of the Second Coalition
Ludwig van Beethoven performs his Moonlight Sonata for the first time

1803.text: William Symington demonstrates his Charlotte Dundas, the 'first practical steamboat'

The United States more than doubles in size when it buys out France's territorial claims in North America via the Louisiana Purchase. This begins the U.S.'s westward expansion to the Pacific referred to as its Manifest Destiny which involves annexing and conquering land from Mexico, Britain, and Native Americans
The Wahhabis of the First Saudi State capture Mecca and Medina
War breaks out between Britain and France; this is considered by some to be the beginning of the Napoleonic Wars

1804.text: Haiti gains independence from France and becomes the first black republic
Austrian Empire founded by Francis I
Napoleon crowns himself Emperor of the French
Serbian revolution erupts against the Ottoman rule. Suzerainty of Serbia recognized in 1817

1805.text: The Battle of Trafalgar eliminates the French and Spanish naval fleets and allows for British dominance of the seas, a major factor for the success of the British Empire later in the century
Napoleon decisively defeats an Austrian-Russian army at the Battle of Austerlitz

1806.text: Holy Roman Empire dissolved as a consequence of the Treaty of Pressburg
Cape Colony becomes part of the British Empire
Russo-Turkish War ends with the Treaty of Bucharest

1807.text: Britain declares the Slave Trade illegal
Potassium and Sodium are individually isolated by Sir Humphry Davy

1808.text: Russia conquers Finland from Sweden in the Finnish War
Spanish guerrillas fight in the Peninsular War
Herman Willem Daendels the Governor-general of the Dutch East Indies (1808–1811) begin the construction of Java Great Post Road

1809.text: Napoleon strips the Teutonic Knights of their last holdings in Bad Mergentheim

1810.text: The University of Berlin was founded. Among its students and faculty are Hegel, Marx, and Bismarck. The German university reform proves to be so successful that its model is copied around the world (see History of European research universities)
The Grito de Dolores begins the Mexican War of Independence
Most of the Latin American colonies free themselves from the Spanish and Portuguese Empires after the Latin American wars of independence

1812.text: The French invasion of Russia is a turning point in the Napoleonic Wars
British Prime Minister Spencer Perceval is assassinated
War of 1812 between the United States and Britain; hence in a draw, except that native Americans lose power

1813.text: Jane Austen publishes Pride and Prejudice

1814.text: Napoleon abdicates and is exiled to Elba
Elisha Collier invents the Flintlock Revolver
The contest between the British Empire and Imperial Russia for control of Central Asia is referred to as the Great Game
Anglo-Nepalese War between Nepal (Gurkha Empire) and British Empire

1815.text: The Congress of Vienna redraws the European map. Reaction And conservatism dominate all of Europe. The Concert of Europe attempts to preserve this settlement, but the forces of liberalism and nationalism make for dramatic changes. It marks the beginning of a Pax Britannica which lasts until 1914
Napoleon escapes exile and begins the Hundred Days before finally being defeated at the Battle of Waterloo and exiled to St Helena. His defeat brings a conclusion to the Napoleonic Wars

Mount Tambora in Sumbawa island erupts, becoming the largest volcanic eruption in recorded history, destroying Tambora culture, and killing at least 71,000 people, including its aftermath. The eruption created global climate anomalies known as 'volcanic winter'
Jane Austen publishes Emma in December

1816.text: Year Without a Summer. Unusually cold conditions wreak havoc throughout the Northern Hemisphere, likely influenced by the 1815 explosion of Mount Tambora
Shaka's Zulu Kingdom becomes the largest in Southern Africa

1817.text: Principality of Serbia becomes suzerain from the Ottoman Empire. Officially independent in 1867
First Seminole War begins in Florida
Russia commences its conquest of the Caucasus
Princess Charlotte of Wales dies following childbirth

1819.text: John Keats writes his odes of 1819
The modern city of Singapore is established by the British East India Company
Théodore Géricault paints his masterpiece The Raft of the Medusa, and exhibits it in the French Salon of 1819 at the Louvre

1820.text: Missouri Compromise regulates slavery in the country's western territories by prohibiting the practice in the former Louisiana Territory north of the parallel 36Â°30â€² north
Regency period ends in the United Kingdom
Liberia founded by the American Colonization Society for freed American slaves

1821.text: Napoleon Bonaparte dies in exile on the island of Saint Helena
Mexico gains independence from Spain with the Treaty of CÃ³rdoba
Peru declares its independence from Spain
Navarino Massacre following the outbreak of the Greek War of Independence
Greece becomes the first country to break away from the Ottoman Empire after the Greek War of Independence

1822.text: First Mexican Empire, as Mexico's first post-independent government, ruled by Emperor AgustÃ­n I of Mexico
Prince Pedro of Brazil proclaimed the Brazilian independence on 7 September. On 1 December, he was crowned as Emperor Dom Pedro I of Brazil

1823.text: The British Empire annexed Burma (now also called Myanmar) after three Anglo-Burmese Wars
Monroe Doctrine declared by US President James Monroe

1825.text: Erie Canal opened connecting the Great Lakes to the Atlantic Ocean
The Stockton and Darlington Railway, the first public railway in the world, is opened
The Cisplatine War results in the independence of Uruguay

1826.text: Samuel Morey patents the internal combustion engine
After the final Russo-Persian War, the Persian Empire took back territory lost to Russia from the previous war

1828.text: Black War in Tasmania leads to the near extinction of the Tasmanian aborigines

1829.text: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe's Faust premieres
First electric motor built by Ãnyos Jedlik
Sir Robert Peel founds the Metropolitan Police Service, the first modern police force

1830.text: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints is established on 6 April 1830
The Belgian Revolution in the United Kingdom of the Netherlands led to the creation of Belgium
Greater Colombia dissolved and the nations of Colombia (including modern-day Panama), Ecuador, and Venezuela took its place
November Uprising in Poland against Russia

End of the Java war. The whole area of Yogyakarta and Surakarta Manca nagara Dutch seized. 27 September, Klaten Agreement determines a fixed boundary between Surakarta and Yogyakarta and permanently divide the kingdom of Mataram was signed by Sasradiningrat, Pepatih Dalem Surakarta, and Danurejo, Pepatih Dalem Yogyakarta. Mataram is a de facto and de yure controlled by the Dutch East Indies

1831.text: The Belgian constitution is ratified and Leopold I is crowned as first 'King of the Belgians'
Great Bosnian uprising against Ottoman rule occurs
Charles Darwin's journey on the HMS Beagle
November Uprising ends with crushing defeat for Poland in the Battle of Warsaw

1832.text: The British Parliament passes the Great Reform Act

1833.text: Slavery Abolition Act bans slavery throughout the British Empire

1834.text: The German Customs Union, or Zollverein is formed
Britain amends the Poor Law demanding that any paupers requesting assistance must go to a workhouse
Imam Shamil's rebellion in Russian-occupied Caucasus

1835.text: The Texas Revolution in Mexico resulted in the short-lived Republic of Texas

1836.text: Battle of the Alamo ends with defeat for Texan separatists
Battle of San Jacinto leads to the capture of General Santa Anna
Samuel Colt popularizes the revolver and sets up a firearms company to manufacture his invention of the Colt Paterson revolver a six bullets firearm shot one by one without reloading manually

1837.text: Queen Victoria's reign is considered the apex of the British Empire and is referred to as the Victorian era

1838.text: By this time, 46,000 Native Americans have been forcibly relocated in the Trail of Tears
Civil war in the Federal Republic of Central America led to the foundings of Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, Nicaragua, and Costa Rica

1839.text: The First Opium War, which will lead to a second and the eventual decline of the Qing dynasty
First Anglo-Afghan War, which will lead to stalemate and the establishment of the Durand line

1840.text: New Zealand is founded, as the Treaty of Waitangi is signed by the MÄori and British
Upper and Lower Canada are merged into the Province of Canada

1841.text: The word 'dinosaur' is coined by Richard Owen

1842.text: Treaty of Nanking cedes Hong Kong to the British
Anaesthesia used for the first time
locations: The University of Vermont College of Medicine

1843.text: The first wagon train sets out from Missouri

1844.text: Persian Prophet the Báb announces his revelation on 23 May, founding Bábísm. He announced to the world of the coming of 'He whom God shall make manifest'. He is considered the forerunner of Bahá'u'lláh, the founder of the Bahá'í Faith

related.title: He whom God shall make manifest

1844.text: First publicly funded telegraph line in the world, between Baltimore and Washington, sends a demonstration message on 24 May, ushering in the age of the telegraph. This message read 'What hath God wrought?' (Bible, Numbers 23:23)
Millerite movement awaits the Second Advent of Jesus Christ on 22 October. Christ's non-appearance becomes known as the Great Disappointment
The great auk is rendered extinct
Dominican War of Independence from Haiti
Heinrich Heine coins the term 'Lisztomania' in regards to the public's frenzied reaction to the pianist Franz Liszt

1845.text: Unification of the Kingdom of Tonga under TÄufa'Ähau (King George Tupou I)
The Irish Potato Famine leads to the Irish diaspora

1846.text: The Mexican-American War leads to Mexico's cession of much of the modern-day Southwestern United States

main.title: History of the Latter Day Saint movement

1847.text: The Brontë sisters publish Jane Eyre, Wuthering Heights and Agnes Grey

1848.text: Seneca Falls Convention is the first women's rights convention in the United States and leads to the battle for women's suffrage

related.title: History of Women's Suffrage in the United States

1848.text: William Holman Hunt, John Everett Millais and Dante Gabriel Rossetti found the Pre-Raphaelite Brotherhood

1849.text: Roman Republic's constitutional law becomes the first to abolish capital punishment
Earliest recorded air raid, as Austria employs 200 balloons to deliver ordnance against Venice

1850.text: The Little Ice Age ends around this time
Alfred Tennyson is appointed Poet Laureate after the death of William Wordsworth
Taiping Rebellion is the bloodiest conflict of the century, leading to the deaths of 20 million people

1851.text: The Great Exhibition in London was the world's first international Expo or World Fair
Louis Napoleon assumes power in France in a coup
The Platine War ends and the Empire of Brazil has the hegemony over South America

1852.text: Frederick Douglass delivers his speech 'The Meaning of July Fourth for the Negro' in Rochester, New York

1853.text: United States Commodore Matthew C. Perry threatens the Japanese capital Edo with gunships, demanding that they agree to open trade
Crimean War between France, the United Kingdom, the Ottoman Empire and Russia

1854.text: Battle of Balaclava and the Charge of the Light Brigade
The Convention of Kanagawa formally ends Japan's policy of isolation
The steamship SS Arctic collides with the SS Vesta and sinks off the coast of Newfoundland
Siege of Sevastapol; city falls to French and British forces

1855.text: Bessemer process enables steel to be mass-produced
Walt Whitman publishes the first edition of Leaves of Grass
Cocaine is isolated by Friedrich Gaedcke

1856.text: Rana dynasty of Nepal established by Jung Bahadur Rana
World's first oil refinery in Romania
Neanderthal man first identified. Age still unknown

1857.text: Sir Joseph Whitworth designs the first long-range sniper rifle
Indian Rebellion of 1857. The British Empire assumes control of India from the East India Company

1858.text: Invention of the phonautograph, the first true device for recording sound
Construction of Big Ben is completed

1859.text: Charles Darwin publishes On the Origin of Species

1860.text: Giuseppe Garibaldi launches the Expedition of the Thousand

1861.text: American Civil War between the Union and seceding Confederacy
French intervention in Mexico and the creation of the Second Mexican Empire, ruled by Maximilian I of Mexico and his consort Carlota of Mexico
James Clerk Maxwell publishes On Physical Lines of Force, formulating the four Maxwell's Equations

1862.text: French gain first foothold in Southeast Asia

1863.text: Bahá'u'lláh declares his station as 'He whom God shall make manifest'. This date is celebrated in the Bahá'í Faith as The Festival of Ridván

related.title: He whom God shall make manifest

1863.text: Formation of the International Red Cross is followed by the adoption of the First Geneva Convention in 1864

main.title: International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement

1863.text: First section of the London Underground opens
Édouard Manet exhibits his painting The Luncheon on the Grass, sparking public outrage
Polish uprising against the Russian Empire

1864.text: The Chincha Islands War was an attempt by Spain to regain its South American colonies
The Paraguayan War ends Paraguayan ambitions for expansion and destroys much of the Paraguayan population
The first railway track in Indonesia was laid between Semarang and Tanggung, Central Java by the Dutch colonial government

1865.text: Reconstruction in the United States; Slavery is banned in the United States by the Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution

main.title: Reconstruction era of the United States

related.title: Thirteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution

1865.text: Robert E. Lee surrenders the Army of Northern Virginia to Ulysses S. Grant at Appomattox Courthouse, Virginia, effectively ending the American Civil War

United States President Abraham Lincoln is assassinated by actor and Confederate sympathiser John Wilkes Booth, while attending a performance at Ford's Theater, Washington, D.C.. He dies approximately nine hours after being shot on 15 April 1865
Gregor Mendel formulates his laws of inheritance
Lewis Carroll publishes Alice's Adventures in Wonderland

1866.text: Successful transatlantic telegraph cable follows an earlier attempt in 1858
Austro-Prussian War results in the dissolution of the German Confederation and the creation of the North German Confederation and the Austrian-Hungarian Dual Monarchy
After the Meiji Restoration, Japan embarks on a program of rapid modernization

1867.text: The United States purchases Alaska from Russia
Canadian Confederation formed, dividing into the new provinces of Ontario and Quebec, while New Brunswick and Nova Scotia became provinces of the new Dominion of Canada
The Principality of Serbia passes a Constitution which defines its independence from the Ottoman Empire. International recognition followed in 1878
The Luxembourg Crisis; a diplomatic confrontation between France and Prussia on the status of Luxembourg and the towns fortifications are torn down

1868.text: The Expatriation Act of 1868 is approved by the U.S. Congress, one of the early blows which would eventually lead to the death of the common law doctrine of perpetual allegiance
The Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution is approved

main.title: Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution

1868.text: Michael Barrett is the last person to be publicly hanged in England
Ten Years' War between Cuba and Spain
The Batavian Museum (today National Museum of Indonesia) was officially opened by Dutch East Indies government

1869.text: Leo Tolstoy publishes War and Peace
First Transcontinental Railroad completed in United States on 10 May. - United States
Dmitri Mendeleev created the Periodic table
The Suez Canal opens linking the Mediterranean to the Red Sea

1870.text: Rasmus Malling-Hansen's invention the Hansen Writing Ball becomes the first commercially sold typewriter
The Franco-Prussian War results in the unifications of Germany and Italy, the collapse of the Second French Empire and the emergence of a New Imperialism
Official dismantling of the Cultivation System and beginning of a 'Liberal Policy' of deregulated exploitation of the Netherlands East Indies

1871.text: In Germany, Otto von Bismarck attacks the privileges of the Catholic Church in the Kulturkampf ('Culture War')
Famine in Persia is believed to have caused the death of 2 million
Royal Albert Hall opens in London
The Paris Commune briefly rules the French capital
The feudal system is dismantled in Japan
Henry Morton Stanley meets Dr. David Livingstone near Lake Tanganyika

1872.text: Yellowstone National Park, the first national park, is created
The first recognised international soccer match, between England and Scotland, is played

1873.text: The Panic of 1873 starts the 'Long Depression'
Maxwell's A Treatise on Electricity and Magnetism published
The samurai class is abolished in Japan

main.title: A Treatise on Electricity and Magnetism

1873.text: The beginning of the bloody Aceh War for Dutch occupation of the province

1874.text: The Société Anonyme Coopérative des Artistes Peintres, Sculpteurs, and Graveurs, better known as the Impressionists, organize and present their first public group exhibition at the Paris studio of the photographer Nadar
The Home Rule Movement is established in Ireland
The British East India Company is dissolved

1875.text: HMS Challenger surveys the deepest point in the Earth's oceans, the Challenger Deep
26 million Indians perish in India due to famine
Georges Bizet's opera Carmen premiers in Paris

1876.text: Bulgarians instigate the April Uprising against Ottoman rule
Richard Wagner's Ring Cycle is first performed in its entirety
Queen Victoria becomes Empress of India
Battle of the Little Bighorn leads to the death of General Custer and victory for the alliance of Lakota, Cheyenne and Arapaho
13 million Chinese die of famine in northern China

1877.text: Great Railroad Strike in the United States may have been the world's first nationwide labour strike
Crazy Horse surrenders and is later killed
Asaph Hall discovers the moons of Mars
Following the Russo-Turkish War, the Treaty of Berlin recognizes formal independence of the Principality of Serbia, Montenegro and Romania. Bulgaria becomes autonomous

1878.text: First commercial telephone exchange in New Haven, Connecticut

1879.text: Anglo-Zulu War in South Africa. - South Africa
Thomas Edison tests his first light bulb
Little War against Spanish rule in Cuba leads to rebel defeat
Chile battles with Peru and Bolivia over Andean territory in the War of the Pacific
Belgium is engulfed in a political crisis, dubbed the First School War, over the role of religion in state education
Kartini was born in Jepara on the 21st April; today the date is commemorated as women's emancipation day in Indonesia

1881.text: Wave of pogroms begins in the Russian Empire

main.title: Anti-Jewish pogroms in the Russian Empire

1881.text: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral. Sitting Bull surrenders
First electrical power plant and grid in Godalming, Britain
President James A. Garfield is assassinated
The Jules Ferry laws are passed in France establishing free, secular education

1882.text: The British invasion and subsequent occupation of Egypt

1883.text: Krakatoa volcano explosion, one of the largest in modern history
Robert Louis Stevenson's Treasure Island is published

1884.text: Mark Twain publishes The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
Sir Hiram Maxim invents the first self-powered Machine gun
The Berlin Conference signals the start of the European 'scramble for Africa'. Attending nations also agree to ban trade in slaves
The Sino-French War led to the formation of French Indochina

1885.text: Louis Pasteur creates the first successful vaccine against rabies for a young boy who had been bitten 14 times by a rabid dog
King Leopold II of Belgium establishes the Congo Free State as a personal fiefdom
Britain establishes a protectorate over Bechuanaland (modern Botswana)
Singer begins production of the Singer Model 27 featuring a vibrating shuttle bobbin driver, which would become the most popular model of sewing machine
Rock Springs massacre. White miners rioted, killing at least 28 Chinese immigrant miners

1886.text: 'The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde' by Robert Louis Stevenson is published

main.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde

1886.text: Burma is presented to Queen Victoria as a birthday gift
Karl Benz sells the first commercial automobile
Construction of the Statue of Liberty

1887.text: The British Empire takes over Balochistan
Sir Arthur Conan Doyle publishes his first Sherlock Holmes story, A Study in Scarlet

1888.text: Louis Le Prince records the Roundhay Garden Scene, the earliest surviving film
Jack the Ripper murders occur in Whitechapel, London
Founding of the shipping line Koninklijke Paketvaart-Maatschappij (KPM) that supported the unification and development of the colonial economy

1889.text: The Mayerling Incident. Crown Prince Rudolf of Austria and Baroness Mary Vetsera are found dead in an apparent murder-suicide
Eiffel Tower is inaugurated in Paris
Mirza Ghulam Ahmad establishes the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community, a reform sect of Islam
End of the Brazilian Empire and the beginning of the Brazilian Republic
Vincent van Gogh paints Starry Night

1890.text: The Wounded Knee Massacre in South Dakota was the last battle in the American Indian Wars. This event represents the end of the American Old West
First use of the electric chair as a method of execution

1891.text: Mirza Ghulam Ahmad, founder of the Ahmadiyya movement, claims to be Promised Messiah and Imam Mahdi
Wrigley Company is founded in Illinois
Pope Leo XIII launches the encyclical Rerum Novarum, the first major catholic document on social justice

1892.text: The World's Columbian Exposition was held in Chicago celebrating the 400th anniversary of Christopher Columbus's arrival in the New World
Fingerprinting is officially adopted for the first time
Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker Suite premières in St Petersberg

1893.text: The Internal Macedonian Revolutionary Organisation is formed
New Zealand becomes the first country to enact women's suffrage
The Coremans-de Vriendt law is passed in Belgium, creating legal equality for French and Dutch languages

1894.text: Karl Elsener invents the Swiss Army knife
After the First Sino-Japanese War, China cedes Taiwan to Japan and grants Japan a free hand in Korea
Lombok War. The Dutch looted and destroyed the Cakranegara palace of Mataram. J. L. A. Brandes, a Dutch philologist discovered and secured Nagarakretagama manuscript in Lombok royal library

1895.text: Trial of Oscar Wilde and premiere of his play The Importance of Being Earnest
French troops capture Antananarivo in Madagascar
Abyssinia defeats Italy in the First Italo–Ethiopian War
Cuban War for Independence results in Cuban independence from Spain

1896.text: Philippine Revolution ends declaring Philippines free from Spanish rule
Ethiopia defeated Italy at the Battle of Adwa
J. J. Thomson identifies the electron, though not by name

1897.text: Gojong, or Emperor Gwangmu, proclaims the short-lived Korean Empire
Benin Expedition of 1897 loots and burns Benin

1898.text: The United States gains control of Cuba, Puerto Rico, and the Philippines after the Spanish–American War
Empress Dowager Cixi of China engineers a coup d'état, marking the end of the Hundred Days' Reform; the Guangxu Emperor is arrested
H. G. Wells publishes The War of the Worlds
Empress Elisabeth of Austria is assassinated by anarchist Luigi Lucheni
The Boxer Rebellion in China is suppressed by an Eight-Nation Alliance
The Thousand Days' War in Colombia breaks out between the 'Liberales' and 'Conservadores', culminating with the loss of Panama in 1903
General van Heutz becomes chief of staff of Aceh campaign.
Wilhelmina becomes queen of the Netherlands

1899.text: Indian famine kills over 1 million people

1900.text: Hawaii becomes an official U.S. territory
Galveston Hurricane in Texas kills 8000 people
L. Frank Baum publishes The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
King Umberto I of Italy is assassinated
Exposition Universelle held in Paris, prominently featuring the growing art trend Art Nouveau
Eight nations invaded China at the same time and ransacked Forbidden City

1901.text: Australian colonies unified under single government
Edward VII becomes King of the United Kingdom and the British Dominions and Emperor of India upon the death of Queen Victoria
Platt Amendment limits the autonomy of Cuba in exchange for withdrawal of American troops
Emily Hobhouse reports on the terrible conditions in the 45 British concentration camps for Boer women and children in South Africa
Guglielmo Marconi receives the first trans-Atlantic radio signal

1902.text: Cuba gains independence from the United States
Willis Carrier invents the first modern electrical air conditioning unit
Venezuela Crisis, in which Britain, Germany and Italy sustain a naval blockade on Venezuela in order to enforce collection of outstanding financial claims

1903.text: First controlled heavier-than-air flight of the Wright Brothers
Herero and Namaqua Genocide, the first genocide of the 20th century, begins in German South-West Africa
In Russia the Bolsheviks and the Mensheviks form from the breakup of the Russian Social Democratic Labor Party
The first Tour de France is held
Independence of Panama, the Hay-Bunau-Varilla Treaty is signed by the United States and Panama
The Ottoman Empire and the German Empire sign an agreement to build the Constantinople-Baghdad Railway

1904.text: Entente Cordiale signed between Britain and France
A Japanese surprise attack on Port Arthur (Lushun) starts the Russo-Japanese War
Construction of the Panama Canal begins
Roger Casement publishes his account of Belgian atrocities in the Congo Free State
End of British expedition to Tibet

1905.text: The British Indian Province of Bengal, was partitioned by the Viceroy of India, Lord Curzon
The Norwegian Parliament declares the union with Sweden dissolved, and Norway achieves full independence

main.title: Dissolution of the union between Norway and Sweden

1906.text: Earthquake in San Francisco, California (death toll: 3000)
Earthquake in Valparaíso, Chile (death toll: 20,000) occur
Stolypin reform in Russia creates a new class of affluent kulaks
Brazilian inventor Alberto Santos-Dumont takes off and flies his 14-bis to a crowd in Paris
The Muslim League is formed by Nawab Salimullah Khan of Dacca
The US began the Second Occupation of Cuba

1907.text: A peasants' revolt in Romania kills roughly 11,000
The Indian National Congress splits into two factions at its Surat session, presided by Rash Behari Bose
Persian Constitutional Revolution ends with the establishment of a parliament
The Anglo-Russian Entente bring a pause in The Great Game in Central Asia
Elections to the new Parliament of Finland are the first in the world with woman candidates, as well as the first elections in Europe where universal suffrage is applied

1908.text: The Ford Motor Company invents the Model T
First commercial Middle-Eastern oilfield established, at Masjed Soleyman in southwest Persia
The Tunguska impact devastates thousands of square kilometres of Siberia
Young Turk Revolution in the Ottoman Empire
Austro-Hungary annexes Bosnia-Herzegovina, triggering the Bosnian Crisis
Pu Yi, the last Emperor of China, assumes the throne
Start of publication of Robert Baden-Powell's Scouting for Boys in London

1909.text: Bosnian crisis ends with Austro-Hungary's annexation of Bosnia and Herzegovina
Robert Peary claims to have reached the North Pole though the claim is subsequently heavily contested
Ottoman countercoup fails in the Ottoman Empire
A revolution forces Mohammad Ali Shah, Persian Shah of the Qajar dynasty to abdicate in favor of his son Ahmad Shah Qajar
Japan and China sign the Jiandao/Gando Treaty

1910.text: George V becomes King of the United Kingdom and the British Dominions and Emperor of India
5 October 1910 revolution in Portugal and proclamation of the First Portuguese Republic
Boy Scouts of America is founded
Montenegro is proclaimed an independent kingdom

1911.text: Xinhai Revolution in China overthrows the Qing Dynasty
Roald Amundsen first reaches the South Pole
Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire results in the deaths of 146 workers and leads to sweeping workplace safety reforms
New Delhi becomes the capital of British India

related.title: Presidencies and provinces of British India

1911.text: Ernest Rutherford identifies the atomic nucleus
The Italo-Turkish war leads to the capture of Libya by Italy
Eugene Ely lands on the deck of the USS Pennsylvania stationed in San Francisco harbor, marking the first time an aircraft lands on a ship

1912.text: End of the Chinese Empire; Republic of China established
The African National Congress is founded
Morocco becomes a protectorate of France

related.title: Changes in safety practices after the sinking of the RMS Titanic
UNESCO Convention on the Protection of the Underwater Cultural Heritage

1912.text: Woodrow Wilson is elected 28th President of the United States
Arizona becomes the last state to be admitted to the continental Union
United States occupation of Nicaragua begins
The Kuomintang, the Chinese nationalist party, is founded

1913.text: Niels Bohr formulates the first cohesive model of the atomic nucleus, and in the process paves the way to quantum mechanics
In the 1913 Ottoman coup d'état, Ismail Enver comes to power
Ford Motor Company introduces the first moving assembly line
La Decena Trágica (Ten Tragic Days) takes place during the Mexican Revolution
Yuan Shikai uses military force to dissolve China's parliament and rules as a dictator
Igor Stravinsky's The Rite of Spring infamously premiers in Paris
First Balkan War Ends, Treaty of London Signed, Second Balkan War and Treaty of Bucharest
The Federal Reserve System is created

1914.text: Gavrilo Princip assassinates Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria in Sarajevo, triggering the start of World War I
The United Kingdom establishes the Sultanate of Egypt as a protectorate
Martha, last known passenger pigeon, dies

1915.text: The United States occupation of Haiti begins
Armenian genocide in the Ottoman Empire
D. W. Griffith's The Birth of a Nation is released
First use of poison gas at the Battle of Neuve Chapelle and Second Battle of Ypres

related.title: Chemical weapons in World War I

1916.text: The implementation of daylight saving time
David Lloyd George becomes the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
First use of tanks at the Battle of Flers-Courcelette
Grigory Rasputin is assassinated by H.H. Prince Felix Youssoupov
The Lucknow Pact is agreed upon by both the Congress and the Muslim League at the Indian city of Lucknow

1917.text: Russian Revolution ends the Russian Empire; beginning of Russian Civil War
USA join the Allies for the last 17 months of World War I

main.title: United States in World War I

1917.text: The first Pulitzer Prizes are awarded

1918.text: Murder of Tsar Nicholas II and his family
Poland, Ukraine and Belarus are among a number of states to declare independence from Russia
Mehmed VI becomes last Sultan of the Ottoman Empire and last Caliph
Partitioning of the Ottoman Empire begins
The Kingdom of Iceland and The State of Slovenes, Croats and Serbs are established

related.title: State of Slovenes, Croats and Serbs

locations: State of Slovenes, Croats And Serbs

1918.text: Mutawakkilite Kingdom of Yemen is founded

1919.text: Treaty of Versailles redraws European borders
German Revolution ends with the collapse of the German Empire and the establishment of the Weimar Republic
Victory for Estonia in the Estonian War of Independence
League of Nations founded in Paris
The Italian National Fascist Party is established by Benito Mussolini
The International Labor Organisation is established
First experimental evidence for the General theory of relativity obtained by Arthur Eddington

1920.text: Greece restores its monarchy after a referendum
Turkish-Armenian War is fought, and ends with victory for Turkey
Red Army invasion of Azerbaijan and Armenia ends the Armenian-Azerbaijani War and concludes with their incorporation into the Soviet Union
Prohibition in the United States enforced

1921.text: Adolf Hitler becomes FÃ¼hrer of the Nazi Party as hyperinflation in the Weimar Republic begins
Russia invades Georgia and incorporates it into the Soviet Union
Coup brings the Pahlavi dynasty to power in Iran

1922.text: Ottoman Sultanate abolished by the Turkish Grand National Assembly; Sultan Mehmed VI is deposed

related.title: Defeat and dissolution of the Ottoman Empire

1922.text: Irish Free State is established, while the Province of Northern Ireland is created within The United Kingdom
The Italian reconquest of Libya begins
The union of Costa Rica, Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador is dissolved
Egypt gains independence from the United Kingdom, though British forces still occupy the Suez Canal

main.title: Egypt gains independence from the United Kingdom

1922.text: March on Rome brings Benito Mussolini to power in Italy
Gabriel Narutowicz, President of Poland is assassinated
The Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR), the world's first officially Communist state, is formed
The Washington Naval Treaty is signed
Mahatma Gandhi calls off Non-cooperation movement

1923.text: Hyperinflation in the Weimar Republic ends with the introduction of the Rentenmark
The Beer Hall Putsch, an attempt to overthrow the Weimar Republic, ends in failure and brief imprisonment for Adolf Hitler but brings the Nazi Party to national attention
A military coup ousts and kills Bulgarian Prime Minister Aleksandar Stamboliyski
The Great KantÅ earthquake kills at least 105,000 people in Japan
Turkish War of Independence ends; Kemal AtatÃ¼rk becomes the first President of the newly established Republic of Turkey; Ankara replaces Istanbul as its capital
The Walt Disney Company is founded

1924.text: Death of Vladimir Lenin triggers power struggle between Leon Trotsky and Joseph Stalin
The Caliphate is abolished by Kamal AtatÃ¼rk
The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation founded under J. Edgar Hoover
The August Uprising in Georgia against Soviet rule
George Gershwin composes Rhapsody In Blue
U.S. Immigration Act of 1924 significantly restricts immigration from Asia, the Middle East, and Southern Europe

1925.text: Benito Mussolini gains dictatorial powers in Italy
First televisual image created by John Logie Baird

1926.text: Coups in Greece, Poland, Lithuania and Portugal install new dictatorships

1927.text: 'The Jazz Singer', the first 'talkie', is released
Joseph Stalin becomes leader of the Soviet Union
Australian Parliament convenes in Canberra for the first time
The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland officially becomes the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

main.title: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland

related.title: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

1927.text: The BBC is granted a Royal Charter in the United Kingdom

1928.text: Discovery of penicillin by Alexander Fleming
King Zog I is crowned in Albania
The Kellogg-Briand Pact is signed in Paris
The International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement is established

main.title: International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement

1928.text: Mickey Mouse is created at the Walt Disney Studio
Hassan al-Banna founds the Muslim Brotherhood

1929.text: Wall Street crash of 1929 and the beginning of the Great Depression
Leon Trotsky is exiled First people sent to the gulag in the Soviet Union as Stalin assumes effective control
Pope Pius XI signs the Lateran Treaty with Italian leader Benito Mussolini
Vatican City is recognised as a sovereign state
The first Academy Awards are presented

1930.text: Aided by the Great Depression, the Nazi Party increases its share of the vote from 2.6% to 18.3%
Salt March by Mahatma Gandhi and the official start of civil disobedience in British India
Military coups replace governments in Peru and Brazil
Haile Selassie becomes king of Abyssinia

1931.text: Floods in China kill up to 2.5 million people
Construction of the Empire State Building
'The Star-Spangled Banner' is adopted as the United States's national anthem
The Second Spanish Republic is declared
The Chinese Soviet Republic is proclaimed by Mao Zedong
Statute of Westminster creates the British Commonwealth of Nations
Japan invades Manchuria, China and occupies it until the end of World War II

1932.text: Franklin D. Roosevelt is elected President of the United States
Éamon de Valera becomes President of the Executive Council (prime minister) of the Irish Free State
The Nazi party becomes the largest single party in the German parliament

1933.text: Adolf Hitler becomes Chancellor of Germany
Japan and Germany announce they are going to leave the League of Nations
United States occupation of Nicaragua ends
Prohibition in the United States is abolished

1934.text: Mao Zedong begins the Long March
United States occupation of Haiti ends
United States grants more autonomy to the Philippines
Adolf Hitler instigates the Night of the Long Knives, which cements his power over both the Nazi Party and Germany
With the death of President Hindenburg, Hitler declares himself Fuhrer of Germany
Bonnie and Clyde are shot to death in a police ambush
John Dillinger is gunned down by the FBI outside the Biograph Theater

1935.text: Second Italo-Ethiopian War concludes with the exile of Haile Selassie and the conquest of Abyssinia by Benito Mussolini
William Lyon Mackenzie King is elected Prime Minister of Canada
Enactment of the Nuremberg racial laws

1936.text: Beginning of the Spanish Civil War
Edward VIII becomes King of the British Commonwealth and Emperor of India, before abdicating and handing the throne to his brother, George VI
George Nissen and Larry Griswold build the first modern trampoline
Arab Revolt in Palestine against the British begins to oppose Jewish immigration
'Benjamin', the last known thylacine, dies in Hobart Zoo

1937.text: Japanese invasion of China, and the beginning of World War II in the Far East
Neville Chamberlain becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
The Irish Republican Army attempts to assassinate King George VI of the United Kingdom

related.title: George VI of the United Kingdom

1937.text: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs is the first feature-length animated movie released

main.title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

1937.text: German zeppelin Hindenburg crashes in Lakehurst, New Jersey

1938.text: Munich agreement hands Czechoslovakia to Nazi Germany
Great Purge ends after nearly 700,000 executions
Kristallnacht in Germany, while Time Magazine declares Adolf Hitler as Man of the Year
DC Comics hero Superman has its first appearance

1939.text: End of Spanish Civil War; Francisco Franco becomes dictator of Spain
Molotov-Ribbentrop Pact between Germany and the Soviet Union
Nazi invasion of Poland triggers the beginning of World War II in Europe
Soviet invasion of Poland begins 16 days later
Palestinian revolt against the British ends

1940.text: Nazis invade France, the Netherlands, Denmark and Norway
Katyn massacre of Polish soldiers in USSR and the Soviet occupation of the Baltic states
Winter War between Soviet Union and Finland
Soviet Union annexes the Baltic states

main.title: Soviet occupation of the Baltic states (1940)

1940.text: Winston Churchill becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
Battle of Britain, the first entirely aerial military campaign, becomes the first significant defeat for the Axis powers
Chechen insurgency begins in Soviet Union

1941.text: Operation Reinhard commences the main phase of The Holocaust
Attack on Pearl Harbor, which leads to the USA joining World War II
Hitler commences the Nazi invasion of the Soviet Union
Siege of Tobruk in North Africa is the first major defeat for Hitler's land forces

1942.text: First and second Battles of El Alamein
Battle of Stalingrad and Guadalcanal Campaign begin
Internment of Japanese-American citizens in the US begins

1943.text: Battle of Stalingrad ends with over two million casualties and the retreat of the German Army
The failed Battle of Kursk becomes the last Nazi offensive on the Eastern Front
Tehran Conference between Franklin Roosevelt, Winston Churchill and Joseph Stalin agrees to launch Operation Overlord

1944.text: The Siege of Leningrad ends with Soviet victory after over a million deaths
Chechen insurgency ends with deportation of the entire Chechen population
First operational electronic computer, Colossus, comes online

1945.text: End of World War II in Europe

main.title: End of World War II in Europe

1945.text: The Holocaust ends after ~12 million deaths, including 6 million Jews
Creation of the atomic bomb, and the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki

related.title: Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki

1945.text: End of World War II in Asia and beginning of the Occupation of Japan

main.title: End of World War II in Asia

1945.text: Potsdam Conference divides Europe into Western and Soviet blocs

related.title: United Nations Conference on International Organization

1946.text: First images taken of the Earth from space
Bhumibol Adulyadej becomes King of Thailand
Mustafa Barzani founds the Kurdistan Democratic Party
Treaty of Manila declares Philippines independent

1947.text: Independence of India and Pakistan and beginning of First Indo-Pakistani War
Invention of the first practical transistor
Harry Truman establishes the Truman Doctrine of containment of Communism
Creation of the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency

1948.text: United Nations establishes Israeli Independence and the formation of the official State of Israel
Marshall Plan; founding of the OECD and the World Health Organization
Beginning of apartheid in South Africa
Division of North and South Korea
The Soviet Sever-2 expedition become the first party to indisputably set foot on the North Pole

1949.text: Partition of Germany into the Soviet socialist German Democratic Republic and the NATO-backed Federal Republic of Germany
COMECON founded by USSR and the Eastern Bloc
Establishment of the People's Republic of China under Mao Zedong; The Republic of China relocates to Taiwan

1950.text: Communist victory in the Landing Operation on Hainan Island and Wanshan Archipelago Campaign end the Chinese Civil War
Lhamo Dondrub becomes the 14th Dalai Lama of Tibet

1951.text: Treaty of San Francisco ends the Occupation of Japan and formally concludes hostilities between Japan and the US

1952.text: Egyptian Revolution under Gamal Abdel Nasser overthrows King Farouk and ends British occupation
Death of King George VI, Queen Elizabeth II becomes Monarch of the Commonwealth realms
Bonn-Paris conventions end allied occupation of West Germany
First Lady of Argentina Eva PerÃ³n dies of cancer aged 33

related.title: First Ladies and Gentlemen of Argentina

1952.text: First scheduled flight by commercial jet
Development of the first effective polio vaccine by Jonas Salk
Mau Mau Uprising begins in Kenya

1953.text: Discovery of the three-dimensional structure of DNA
Death of Joseph Stalin; East German Uprising leads to the arrest and execution of Lavrentiy Beria; power struggle begins between Georgy Malenkov and Nikita Khrushchev
Elvis Presley's musical career is launched

1954.text: Paris Treaty establishes Western European Union
Supreme Court of the United States decides Brown v Board of Education, ordering an end to racial segregation in public schools

main.title: Racial segregation in the United States

related.title: Supreme Court of the United States

1954.text: Rock Around the Clock by Bill Haley & His Comets, brings rock and roll to the American mainstream
The Soviet Union generates first electricity by nuclear power

1955.text: Nikita Khrushchev assumes control of the Soviet Union
Formation of the Central Treaty Organization

1956.text: The Hungarian Uprising crushed by Soviet troops
Nasser's nationalisation of the Suez Canal triggers the Suez crisis

1957.text: Launch of Sputnik 1 and the beginning of the Space Age
Treaty of Rome, which would eventually lead to the European Union
Harold Macmillan become British Prime Minister
First prescription of the combined oral contraceptive pill

1958.text: Great Chinese Famine begins in China
Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament (CND) founded, and their symbol, the peace sign, is first used
Invention of the optical disc and the cassette tape

1959.text: Admission of Alaska and Hawaii into the United States
Uprising in Tibet against China leads to the exile of the Dalai Lama
First images of the far side of the Moon
Ritchie Valens, Buddy Holly and The Big Bopper die in a plane crash

1960.text: 1960 U-2 incident sparks deterioration in relations between superpowers
Year of Africa: Independence of 17 African nations
Khrushchev withdraws Soviet cooperation with China, initiating the Sino-Soviet split
The Birth control pill becomes commercially available
United States presidential election marks the first televised debates between presidential candidates
First manned descent to the deepest point on Earth, the Mariana Trench
Muhammad Ali wins gold in Rome

1961.text: Great Leap Forward ends in China after the deaths of roughly 20 million people
Congo Crisis: Assassination of Prime Minister Patrice Lumumba
UN Secretary General Dag HammarskjÃ¶ld dies in a plane crash

1962.text: Algerian war ends with the independence of Algeria
The Beatles' first record and the beginnings of the British Invasion
A coup ends the Mutawakkilite Kingdom of Yemen and establishes the Yemen Arab Republic
Second Vatican Council is opened by Pope John XXIII

1963.text: Martin Luther King, Jr. delivers 'I Have a Dream' at the March on Washington

related.title: March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom

1963.text: Launch of the first geosynchronous satellite

1964.text: Leonid Brezhnev ousts Khrushchev and assumes power in the Soviet Union
Civil Rights Act abolishes segregation in the USA
The Beatles first visit to the United States

main.title: The Beatles in the United States

1965.text: Congo Crisis ends; Joseph Mobutu becomes dictator of the Congo
Anti-Communist purge in Indonesia kills up to 500,000 people

1967.text: Attempted secession of the Republic of Biafra from Nigeria triggers the Nigerian Civil War
Association of Southeast Asian Nations founded

related.title: Member states of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations

related.title: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band

main.title: Assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr.

1968.text: Prague Spring crushed by Eastern Bloc military intervention
The Troubles begin in Northern Ireland
Tet Offensive occurs in South Vietnam

1969.text: Creation of ARPANET, the earliest incarnation of the Internet
Muammar Gaddafi overthrows King Idris of Libya in a Coup d'état and establishes the Libyan Arab Republic

1970.text: Nigerian Civil War ends with the reintegration of the Republic of Biafra with Nigeria after ~3 million deaths
Edward Heath becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
Kent State massacre leaves four students dead and nine injured
Ratification of the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons

main.title: Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons

1970.text: Containerisation adopted globally, massively boosting global trade
Bhola Cyclone kills 500,000 people in East Pakistan
Anwar Sadat becomes President of Egypt
FLQ seizes hostages, causing Prime Minister Pierre Elliot Trudeau of Canada to issue the War Measures Act

1971.text: Bangladesh Liberation War ends in independence of Bangladesh from Pakistan and precipitates Third Indo-Pakistani War
Idi Amin seizes power in Uganda
Mobutu Sese Seko renames The Republic of the Congo Zaire

1972.text: Martial law declared in the Philippines by President Ferdinand E. Marcos

1973.text: First space station, Skylab, is launched
The Supreme Court of the United States decides Roe v Wade

1974.text: Carnation Revolution in Portugal begins transition to democracy

Discovery of 'Lucy' (Australopithecus afarensis) in Tanzania's Olduvai Gorge

Death of Francisco Franco; Juan Carlos I becomes King of Spain
Haile Selassie I dies in mysterious circumstances
Cambodian Civil War ends with victory for the Khmer Rouge

Steve Wozniak invented the Apple I and Steve Jobs then convinced Wozniak to sell the system, giving birth to Apple Computer

1977.text: Introduction of the first mass-produced personal computers
Launch of the Voyager spacecraft, currently the most distant man-made objects in the universe
Queen Alia of Jordan is killed in helicopter crash
Tenerife disaster marks the deadliest accident in aviation history
Shaba I conflict involves Safari Club

1978.text: Jim Jones's New religious movement The Peoples Temple ends in the organized mass killing and suicide of 920 people
Birth of the first test-tube baby

1978.text: Spanish transition to democracy is completed

1979.text: Iranian Revolution and Iran hostage crisis
Shah Reza Pahlavi forced into exile
Arrival of Pope John Paul II in Poland, eventually sparking the Solidarity movement
Margaret Thatcher becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
Implementation of China's One child policy
Uganda-Tanzania War ends with defeat for Uganda and the exile of Idi Amin
Cambodian-Vietnamese War ends with the overthrow of Cambodia's Khmer Rouge regime
1.7 million people known to have been murdered in The Killing Fields

1980.text: Independence of Rhodesia, which becomes Zimbabwe
Ronald Reagan is elected President of the United States
Queen Beatrix becomes monarch of the Netherlands
Beginning of the Salvadorian Civil War
Assassination of Salvadoran Archbishop Oscar Romero
Disappearance and death of Azaria Chamberlain
Solidarity union forms at Poland's GdaÅ„sk Shipyard under Lech WaÅ‚Ä™sa, and begins agitation for greater personal freedoms

1981.text: First orbital flight of the Space Shuttle
Wedding of Charles, Prince of Wales, and Lady Diana Spencer

main.title: Wedding of Charles, Prince of Wales, and Lady Diana Spencer

1982.text: Death of Leonid Brezhnev; Yuri Andropov becomes leader of the Soviet Union

main.title: Death and state funeral of Leonid Brezhnev

1982.text: Hama massacre in Syria leads to more than 10,000 deaths
First execution by lethal injection takes place in Texas
Sony releases the worlds first commercially sold CD Player, the Sony CDP-101
Princess Grace of Monaco dies following a car accident

1983.text: GPS development declassified following the downing of Korean Air Lines Flight 007
Invasion of Grenada by the United States
Bombing of U.S. Embassy in Beirut

1984.text: The human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) is recognized as the cause of HIV/AIDS, and research on zidovudine and other treatments gets underway
Death of Yuri Andropov; Konstantin Chernenko becomes Premier of the Soviet Union
Beginning of the 1984-1985 famine in Ethiopia
Beginning of the UK miners' strike
Sino-British Joint Declaration agrees to hand Hong Kong back to China by 1997

End of military leadership in Brazil

1986.text: Launch of the space station Mir
First close up images of the planet Uranus
End of dictatorship of Ferdinand Marcos in the Philippines
The antidepressant drug Prozac becomes commercially available

1988.text: Perestroika begins, precipitating the dissolution of the Soviet Union, the revolutions of 1989 in Eastern Europe, and the end of the Cold War

1988.text: End of dictatorship of Augusto Pinochet in Chile
Pan Am Flight 103 falls over Lockerbie, Scotland
Construction of the Channel Tunnel begins
George H. W. Bush is elected President of the United States

1989.text: Fall of the Berlin Wall; 1989 revolution and collapse of the Soviet Bloc in Europe

Death of Emperor Hirohito, his son Akihito becomes Emperor of Japan

related.title: History of the World Wide Web

Tatmadaw place Aung San Suu Kyi under house arrest
North and South Yemen unify to form the Republic of Yemen

The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change releases its first assessment report, linking increases in carbon dioxide in the Earth's atmosphere, and resultant rise in global temperature, to human activities

1991.text: Gulf War ends in US withdrawal and failed uprising
Dissolution of the Soviet Union and independence of 15 former Soviet republics
Boris Yeltsin becomes the first President of the Russian Federation
Ten-Day War in Slovenia begins the Yugoslav Wars
Beginning of the Somali Civil War
Beginning of the Sierra Leonian Civil War
Beginning of the Algerian Civil War
The first Website is put online and made available to the public
Final end of the Khmer Rouge in Cambodia

1992.text: Maastricht Treaty creates the European Union
Bill Clinton is elected President of the United States
End of dictatorship in South Korea
Los Angeles riots over the acquittal of those involved in the beating of Rodney King

1993.text: Velvet divorce between Czech Republic and Slovakia
Oslo accords end First Intifada between Israel and Palestine
The Waco siege ends after a 51-day standoff, leaving 86 people dead

1994.text: End of apartheid in South Africa and election of Nelson Mandela
Establishment of the North American Free Trade Agreement
Assassination of Juvénal Habyarimana and Cyprien Ntaryamira triggers the Rwandan genocide

main.title: Assassination of Juvénal Habyarimana and Cyprien Ntaryamira

1994.text: Death of Kim Il-sung, Kim Jong-Il becomes Supreme Leader of North Korea

1995.text: Establishment of the World Trade Organization
American terrorist Timothy McVeigh bombs the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building in Oklahoma City
NATO bombing raids in Bosnia end the Bosnian War; Dayton Accords signed
Austria, Finland and Sweden join the European Union

1996.text: Dolly the sheep becomes the first successful cloned mammal
The Taliban government takes control of Afghanistan
Port Arthur massacre leaves 35 people dead, leading to tighter gun regulations in Australia

1997.text: Tony Blair becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
Transfer of sovereignty over Hong Kong from UK to China

main.title: Transfer of sovereignty over Hong Kong

1997.text: Kabila ousts Mobutu: Zaire becomes the Democratic Republic of the Congo
Diana, Princess of Wales is killed in a car accident in Paris

main.title: Death of Diana, Princess of Wales

1997.text: Sound barrier broken on land by Thrust SSC

1998.text: Osama bin Laden publishes a fatwa against the West
Google is founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin
Good Friday Agreement brings an end to The Troubles in Northern Ireland
North Korean famine kills an estimated 2.5 million people by this point

1999.text: Kosovo War ends the Yugoslav Wars
Hugo Chavez becomes President of Venezuela
Crisis in East Timor leads to 1400 deaths
Columbine High School massacre in Colorado, USA

2000.text: End of Israeli occupation of Lebanon
George W. Bush is elected President of the United States
Vicente Fox becomes the first opposition President of Mexico
Vladimir Putin becomes President of Russia
British Army launch Operation Palliser which effectively ends the Sierra Leone Civil War
al-Qaeda suicide bombs the USS Cole

2001.text: September 11 attacks: Terrorists destroy the World Trade Center in New York City, damage The Pentagon in Washington, DC
During economic crisis in Argentina government effectively froze all bank accounts for twelve months which led to riots and President de la Rúa's resignation from office
President Joseph Estrada of the Philippines impeached

2002.text: Chechen rebels seize theatre in Moscow
America demands Iraq allow unfettered access to weapons inspectors
Guantanamo Bay detention camp is established

2003.text: Iraq War begins, triggering worldwide protests
The Human Genome Project is completed
Second Congo War ends with more than 5 million dead
Space Shuttle Columbia is destroyed on re-entry

2004.text: Enlargement of NATO and the European Union incorporates most of former Eastern Bloc
Union of South American Nations formed
Boxing Day Tsunami occurs in Indian Ocean, leading to the deaths of 230,000

2005.text: IRA end military campaign in Northern Ireland
Angela Merkel becomes Germany's first woman Chancellor
Cedar Revolution in Lebanon triggered by the Assassination of Rafic Hariri
Hurricane Katrina kills nearly 2000 people in the Gulf of Mexico
80,000 are killed in an earthquake in Kashmir
The Kyoto Protocol comes into effect
Mahmoud Ahmadinejad becomes President of Iran
Death of Pope John Paul II; Benedict XVI becomes Pope

2006.text: Comprehensive Peace Accord ends the Nepalese Civil War
Ellen Johnson Sirleaf becomes President of Liberia, and thus Africa's first elected female head of state
The International Astronomical Union creates the the first formal definition of a planet, and excludes Pluto from the list
The Baiji, the Yangtze river dolphin, becomes functionally extinct

2007.text: Anti-government protests in Myanmar crushed by ruling junta
Spike in food prices and subprime crisis help trigger global recession

2008.text: Barack Obama is elected President of the United States
Kosovo declares independence, to mixed reaction
Battle of Basra - Iraqi forces crack down on Muqtada al Sadr's Mahdi forces in Basra and Sadr City

2009.text: Gaza War ends; Gaza blockade continues
Boko Haram rebellion begins in Nigeria
Burj Khalifa in Dubai, the world's tallest skyscraper, is completed

2010.text: A 7.0 magnitude earthquake in Haiti kills 230,000
Threat of Greece defaulting on its debts triggers the European sovereign debt crisis and Ireland's financial crisis
The largest oil spill in US history occurs in the Gulf of Mexico
North Korea shells the island of Yeonpyeong
Aung San Suu Kyi released from house arrest
The website WikiLeaks releases thousands of classified US documents
Arab Spring triggered by self-immolation of Mohamed Bouazizi on December 17, 2010 in Tunisia
10 April the President of Poland, Lech KaczyÅ„ski, is among 96 killed when their airplane crashes in Smolensk

2011.text: Arab Spring: revolutions in Tunisia, Egypt and Libya follow, as well as uprisings in Yemen and Bahrain, and protests in several other Arab countries
A 9.0 earthquake in Japan triggers a tsunami and the meltdown of the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant
Second Ivorian Civil War ends with the arrest of former president Laurent Gbagbo

main.title: Death and state funeral of Kim Jong-il
Withdrawal of U.S. troops from Iraq

2011.text: Domodedovo International Airport bombing in Russia

2012.text: 2012 Northern Mali conflict, the MNLA declares Azawad an independent state

related.title: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad

2012.text: Yemeni President Ali Abdullah Saleh steps down
2012 Benghazi attack leads to the death of US ambassador J. Christopher Stevens
Hurricane Sandy kills 209 people in North America
Typhoon Bopha kills over 1,600 in the Philippines
Skydiver Felix Baumgartner becomes the first person to break the sound barrier without a vehicle
Conflict begins in the Central African Republic
UN Climate Change Conference agrees to extend the Kyoto Protocol until 2020
Israel launches Operation Pillar of Defense against the Palestinian-governed Gaza Strip

2013.text: The French military intervenes in the Northern Mali conflict
Resignation of Pope Benedict XVI, Pope Francis becomes Pope
Edward Snowden releases classified documents concerning mass surveillance by the NSA
President of Egypt Mohamed Morsi is deposed by the military in a coup d'état
Croatia becomes a member of the European Union
The Euromaidan protest begins in Ukraine
A chemical attack in Ghouta, Syria is blamed on President Bashar al-Assad
Typhoon Haiyan kills nearly 6150 people in the Philippines and Vietnam

main.title: Death and state funeral of Hugo Chávez

2013.text: Uruguay becomes the first country to fully legalise cannabis

2014.text: The worst Ebola virus epidemic in recorded history begins in West Africa, to date infecting more than 20,000 people and killing more than 7,000

main.title: Ebola virus epidemic in West Africa

2014.text: Euromaidan protest in Ukraine sparks a revolution and the overthrow of Viktor Yanukovych, leading to Russia's annexation of Crimea and the War in Donbass

related.title: Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation

2014.text: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 is shot down over Ukraine
Air Algérie Flight 5017 crashes in Mali
A coup d'état in Thailand overthrows the caretaker government
King Juan Carlos I of Spain abdicates; his son becomes King Felipe VI
Israel launches an assault on the Gaza Strip in response to tit-for-tat murder-kidnappings, leading to the deaths of 71 Israelis and 2100 Palestinians

related.title: 2014 kidnapping and murder of Israeli teenagers
Kidnapping and murder of Mohammed Abu Khdeir

2014.text: ISIS begins its offensive in northern Iraq, leading to intervention in Iraq and Syria by a US-led coalition

main.title: Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant

2015.text: The Rosetta spacecraft's Philae probe becomes the first to successfully land on a comet
The New Horizons spacecraft becomes the first spacecraft to explore Pluto
